channel.title: October 2025 on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in October 2025 on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: ai: What’s new in Microsoft Foundry | October and November 2025
item.description:
Azure AI Foundry has been renamed Microsoft Foundry. The October–November 2025 update highlights new announcements across agents, models, tools, and related platform improvements.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: vscode: October 2025 (version 1.106)
item.description:
Announcement page for the Visual Studio Code October 2025 release (version 1.106) pointing readers to the full release notes.

  • Source: Visual Studio Code

item.title: github: Secret scanning detects Base64-encoded secrets and more — October 2025
item.description:
GitHub announced October 2025 updates to its secret scanning service, including new detection for Base64-encoded secrets and other expanded support for additional secret types.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GPT-4.1 Copilot code completion model — October update
item.description:
GitHub updated the GPT-4.1 Copilot code completion model (October update) to better infer developer intent from surrounding code, resulting in more accurate code completion suggestions in GitHub Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Locations API Update for UK Azure Regions
item.description:
Azure has updated the Locations API metadata for UK-based regions by changing the geographyGroup and regionalDisplayName fields to meet evolving compliance and regulatory requirements. The changes are in effect October 2025.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework October 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description:
A brief recap announcing the October 2025 servicing updates for .NET and .NET Framework. The post on the .NET Blog summarizes the latest fixes and directs readers to the official release information.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: security: Azure mandatory multifactor authentication: Phase 2 starting in October 2025
item.description:
Microsoft Azure will begin Phase 2 mandatory multi-factor authentication enforcement at the Azure Resource Manager layer starting October 1, 2025, as announced on the Microsoft Security Blog.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog
